channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Summer Game Fest returns June 10th to unofficially kickoff E3
item.description: Expect 'more than a dozen' world premieres and announcements.

item.title: Coinbase struggles with outages during cryptocurrency volatility
item.description: Coinbase is reeling from outages as a massive cryptocurrency selloff takes place.

item.title: Qualcomm's Snapdragon 778G is a 6nm chip for 5G phones
item.description: Qualcomm has officially launched the Snapdragon 778G 5G processor, which will power the Honor 50 series and other upcoming mid-to-high-end devices.

item.title: Rocket League's Formula 1 Fan Pack arrives May 20th
item.description: After mining our 80s nostalgia a few years ago, Rocket League is now gearing up to introduce F1 cars tomorrow, May 20th.

item.title: Qualcomm brings 10-gigabit 5G to laptops and home broadband
item.description: Qualcomm has unveiled an M.2 reference design that brings 10-gigabit 5G to your laptop or home broadband.

item.title: This productivity app lets you annotate screenshots and PDFs
item.description: Markup Hero is a convenient program that lets you annotate and edit screenshots and PDFs before sharing them. Get a two-year subscription now.

item.title: J.J. Abrams is bringing a new Batman animated series to HBO Max
item.description: J.J. Abrams is teaming up with Bruce Timm for Batman: the Caped Crusader on HBO Max.

item.title: Samsung's latest Tokyo Olympics phone might actually happen
item.description: Samsung has unveiled a version of the Galaxy S21 to mark the Tokyo Olympics — provided the games aren't postponed again.

item.title: What to know before buying a smartwatch
item.description: Here’s a list of the best smartwatches you can buy, plus advice on how to choose one.

item.title: The Apple Watch Series 6 is $60 off at Amazon and B&H Photo
item.description: Save big on the Apple Watch Series 6, which is $60 off at Amazon and B&H Photo.

item.title: iPad Pro (2021) review: Apple’s hardware may have outpaced its software
item.description: For the last week, I’ve been living with Apple’s new iPad Pro, and there are two thoughts I haven’t been able to shake. The first is that this might be the best portable computer Apple has ever made. I mean, think about it: This iPad uses the exact same chipset you’ll find in the MacBook Air, the MacBook Pro, and even the new iMac. That’s unheard of for a tablet, especially one with 5G and a screen that puts Apple’s laptops to shame. Tim Cook once said the iPad was the company’s vision of the future of computing, and it’s actually starting to feel like it’s coming to fruition. Which leads me to my second unshakeable thought: Because this thing is so powerful, it’s begging for more robust software. The new iPad Pro very much feels a portent of dramatic changes to come, but in this moment, it’s — for better or worse — just an obscenely powerful tablet.

item.title: Zoom is launching a dedicated Events platform
item.description: Zoom is launching an events platform that builds on its OnZoom beta test to offer a hub for online and real world gatherings.

item.title: Nintendo Switch Online will soon offer over 100 classic games
item.description: Nintendo will soon add five more classic games to Switch Online, bringing the total number of titles you can play through the subscription service to 104.

item.title: 'Call of Duty: Warzone' is adding Rambo and John McClane
item.description: Call of Duty: Warzone is adding '80s action heroes Rambo and Die Hard's John McClane as part of a mid-season update.

item.title: Most new NVIDIA RTX gaming GPUs will be crypto-limited
item.description: NVIDIA is extending its limits on GPU capacity to more GeForce RTX 30-series cards in a bid to limit the shortages caused by cryptomining.

item.title: IFA 2021 is canceled after all
item.description: After organizers announced a "full-scale return" last month, IFA 2021 in Berlin has been canceled as physical live event due to COVID-19 health concerns.

item.title: The Morning After: Android’s new look is called Material You
item.description: Today’s headlines: President Biden reveals Ford's electric F-150 a day early in factory speech, Android’s new look is called Material You and Google and Samsung joined forces on the new Wear OS.

item.title: Spotify will stream a virtual concert series that begins on May 27th
item.description: Livestreamed concerts helped us get through the pandemic and now Spotify will offer five prerecorded performances as ticketed events.

item.title: Watch a 'blind' robot successfully navigate stairs
item.description: It's routine for four-legged robots with computer vision to navigate stairs, but getting a "blind" bipedal robot to do it is a whole other challenge.

item.title: Otter's assistant can transcribe your Zoom Meetings for you
item.description: Otter Assistant will attend Zoom calls on your behalf and take notes for you.

item.title: Google is finally bringing YouTube Music to Wear OS
item.description: Google is finally launching a YouTube Music app for Wear OS, but it doesn't have a release date yet.

item.title: 'Resident Evil: Infinite Darkness' premieres on Netflix July 8th
item.description: Check out the two-minute official trailer for 'Resident Evil: Infinite Darkness.'

item.title: Amazon extends ban on police use of its facial recognition software
item.description: Reuters reports that 'until further notice' Amazon will continue to bar police departments from using its Rekognition platform

item.title: Google wants to make shopping easier in Photos and Chrome
item.description: In Photos, Google is making it easier to search screenshots for products.

item.title: Google is helping developers build Android apps for bigger screens
item.description: As usual, Google followed up its big I/O keynote with a quicker session focused specifically on the new tools it'll offer the developer community in the coming months. The entire developer keynote is up on YouTube, but here are a handful of things that caught our eyes.
